column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction

#Text=Climate change is a natural phenomenon , but the increase in greenhouse gases due to human activities , which alters the climatic system , have become triggers for more rapid changes and influences the occurrence of extreme climatic events .
#Text=Climate change contributes to increased frequency of extreme weather events , such as drought .
#Text=The severity of the drought is likely to increase in many parts of the world .
#Text=Drought , because of its insidious nature , is generally difficult to define and explain .
#Text=Droughts are recognized as a natural environmental catastrophe and have attracted multidisciplinary attention across all researcher fields .
#Text=Globally , demand for water and even water scarcity has risen owing to population increase and industrial development .
#Text=Other factors , such as climate change , have added to the water shortage .

#Text=The choice of a suitable drought characteristic for particular drought research depends on the hydro-climatology in the selected region , the type of drought regarded , the vulnerability of nature in that region , the purpose of the research study and the accessible information for the drought evaluation .
#Text=Limited or lacking adequate quantifiable occurrence , frequency and severity information remains an issue in this respect .
#Text=Furthermore , there is a lack of sufficient and appropriate methods for evaluating and forecasting drought .
#Text=To prepare for effective risk and management of drought mitigation , it is vital to assess the conditions of drought .
#Text=The classification system for the drought of four types is based on the nature of water deficiency .

#Text=Meteorological , hydrological and agricultural droughts are considered environmental droughts according to this classification and are defined as periods with insufficient precipitation , river flow or groundwater , and soil moisture , respectively .
#Text=The fourth type of drought is socio-economic drought , which is associated with water resource systems failing to meet water demands .
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=presents the classification system for drought was derived from .
#Text=Droughts are long-term phenomena that affect large regions and cause severe damage to human lives and economic losses .
#Text=This study mainly focuses on hydrological drought .
#Text=Hydrological drought is usually characterized by water loss over time from both underground and surface supplies .
#Text=It usually affects water levels from average to low , making it inadequate to meet human and ecosystem requirements .
#Text=Streamflow is the most crucial water quantity variable .
#Text=Streamflow is the most crucial variable in quantity of water that expresses the resources of surface water .
#Text=Therefore , in terms of normal conditions , a hydrological drought occurrence is linked to the streamflow deficit .
#Text=The assessment of hydrological drought plays an essential role in water resources management .
#Text=Hydrological drought assessment is necessary because human activities depend on either surface water or groundwater resources .
#Text=Data on streamflow is generally used for hydrological drought analysis .
#Text=Recovery from hydrological drought is usually prolonged , considering the time it takes to recharge streams and lakes .
#Text=Increased water consumption has also significantly increased the magnitude of hydrological drought by 10 – 50 % and increased the frequency of global drought by 30 % .
#Text=Hydrological drought
#Text=characteristics , including groundwater and streamflow , will change due to climate change in the 21st century .
#Text=There will be increased duration and severity of hydrological drought and more significant impacts of events , including on groundwater and streamflow , will be evident .
#Text=Therefore , there is an urgent need for the management of water resources to design proactive measures to reduce these significant issues .
#Text=Assessment approaches for hydrological drought can be separated into two groups .
#Text=The first group consists of the characteristics of low flow and the second approach to analyse drought is to use the attributes of the deficit analysis .
#Text=Most hydrological drought evaluation techniques are based on hydrological parameter analysis of the actual time series of streamflow .
#Text=In comparison , the values from the measured time series are taken below a defined threshold level when determining the deficit characteristics .
#Text=The drought deficit index is computed from deficit characteristics such as the duration of the deficit period and volumes of the deficit .
#Text=The vulnerability of the area of interest in the risk of drought can then be assessed based on two defined indices .
